article.title: Children brought to U.S. get break

title_result: Hearing of the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee Subject: "Challenges at the Border: Examining the Causes, Consequences, and Responses to the Rise in Apprehensions at the Southern Border" Chaired by: Senator Tom Carper (D-DE) Witnesses: Craig Fugate, Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency in the Homeland Security Department; Gil Kerlikowske, Commissioner of the U.S. Customs and Border Protection in the Homeland Security Department; Thomas Winkowski, Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary of Homeland Security for U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement; Mark Greenberg, Acting Assistant Secretary of Health and Human Services for the Administration for Children and Families; Francisco Palmieri, Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for the Caribbean and Central America in the Bureau of Western Hemisphere Affairs; Juan Osuna, Director of the Justice Department's Executive Office of Immigration Review Location: 342 Dirksen Senate Office Building, Washington, D.C.
